segment.source: Use the test application ID and ad unit ID values from this article to see how your app renders ads during testing.
segment.target: Use the test application ID and ad unit ID values from this article to see how your app renders ads during testing.

segment.source: Test mode values
segment.target: Test mode values

segment.source: Test mode values
segment.target: Test mode values

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: When you use an AdControl or InterstitialAd to display ads in your app, you must specify an application ID and ad unit ID.
segment.target: When you use an AdControl or InterstitialAd to display ads in your app, you must specify an application ID and ad unit ID.

segment.source: While you are developing your app, use the test application ID and ad unit ID values from this article to see how your app renders ads during testing.
segment.target: While you are developing your app, use the test application ID and ad unit ID values from this article to see how your app renders ads during testing.

segment.source: Important If your app uses ad mediation (that is, it uses an AdMediatorControl object), you do not need to specify ad units.
segment.target: Important If your app uses ad mediation (that is, it uses an AdMediatorControl object), you do not need to specify ad units.

segment.source: In this scenario, ad units are automatically generated for you.
segment.target: In this scenario, ad units are automatically generated for you.

segment.source: For more information, see What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl.
segment.target: For more information, see What is the difference: AdMediatorControl or AdControl.

segment.source: If you try to use test values in your app after you publish it, your live app not receive ads.
segment.target: If you try to use test values in your app after you publish it, your live app not receive ads.

segment.source: To receive ads in your published app, you must update your code to use an application ID and ad unit ID provided by the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: To receive ads in your published app, you must update your code to use an application ID and ad unit ID provided by the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
segment.target: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.

segment.source: Here are the test values to use for video interstitial and banner ads.
segment.target: Here are the test values to use for video interstitial and banner ads.

segment.source: For video interstitial ads:
segment.target: For video interstitial ads:

segment.source: AdUnitId
segment.target: AdUnitId

segment.source: AppId
segment.target: AppId

segment.source: For banner ads:
segment.target: For banner ads:

segment.source: AdUnitId
segment.target: AdUnitId

segment.source: AppId
segment.target: AppId

segment.source: Important The size of a live ad is defined by the Width and Height properties of the AdControl.
segment.target: Important The size of a live ad is defined by the Width and Height properties of the AdControl.

segment.source: For best results, make sure that the Width and Height properties in your code are one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.
segment.target: For best results, make sure that the Width and Height properties in your code are one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.

segment.source: The Width and Height properties will not change based on the size of a live ad.
segment.target: The Width and Height properties will not change based on the size of a live ad.
